intro: Epilobium delicatum var. tenue, commonly known as slender willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, often rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or reddish, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other moist habitats.
